Arg.V:
#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk device-mapper
exit 0

#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi

if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi

isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk device-mapper-devel
exit 0

#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk lvm2-sysvinit
exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: lvm2 bug fix and enhancement update
Vulnerability.Description: The lvm2 packages include complete support for handling read and write operations on physical volumes, creating volume groups from one or more physical volumes, and creating one or more logical volumes in volume groups. This update fixes the following bugs: Previously, the dm-event.socket and lvm2-lvmetad.socket systemd units incorrectly referenced the "RemoveOnStop" property, which was not available in the previous version of systemd. As a consequence, the "Unknown lvalue 'RemoveOnStop' in section 'Socket'" error occurred at boot time or when systemd reloaded its units. With this update, "RemoveOnStop" is recognized, so the dm-event.socket and lvm2-lvmetad.socket can reference this property, and the error message no longer occurs. (BZ#1200946) In an earlier version, LVM2 introduced support for write caching mode, which is stored in metadata. Consequently, metadata without caching mode was considered invalid and the system could become unbootable. With this update, metadata without set cache mode uses the default caching mode write-through. As a result, logical volumes with older metadata can be activated as expected. (BZ#1207714) Also, this update fixes bugs in the following areas: thin provisioning (BZ#1163530, BZ#1166873) cache (BZ#1269677, BZ#1269677, BZ#1167431, BZ#1243982, BZ#1247378, BZ#1255184) raid (BZ#1186903, BZ#1067112, BZ#1194464) lvm2app library (BZ#1211183, BZ#1139920) PV handling (BZ#1185438, BZ#1106425) lvmetad (BZ#1106425) clvmd (BZ#1081940, BZ#1140095) blkdeactivate script (BZ#1201733, BZ#1209855) documentation (BZ#1038524, BZ#1193925) In addition, this update adds the following enhancement: LVM volume groups can now be assigned an owner. The volume group owner is the system ID of a host. Only the host with the given system ID can use the VG. This can benefit volume groups that exist on shared devices, visible to multiple hosts, which are otherwise not protected from concurrent use from multiple hosts. LVM volume groups on shared devices with an assigned system ID are owned by one host and protected from other hosts. (BZ#1246231) Also, this update adds enhancements in the following areas: LVM reporting, processing, and selection (BZ#1240518, BZ#1085684, BZ#1240538) thin provisioning (BZ#1153362, BZ#1189215, BZ#1189051) cache (BZ#1229756) IO reporting (BZ#1222101) polldaemon (BZ#1044705) lvmconf script (BZ#1211507) Users of lvm2 are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix these bugs and add these enhancements. Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
